intro: Orthodon, commonly known as the common orthodon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Orthodon is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in temperate regions.
